title: Regulates hatcheries that raise trout and black bass for food fish
summary: Regulates hatcheries that raise trout and black bass for food fish.

S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K

                                          448

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                      (PREFILED)

                                    January 5, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  M.  of A. MAGEE, CROUCH -- read once and referred to the
         Committee on Agriculture

       AN ACT to amend the agriculture and markets law  and  the  environmental
         conservation law, in relation to the regulation of food fish

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. The agriculture and markets law is amended by adding a  new
    2  article 5-E to read as follows:
    3                                 ARTICLE 5-E
    4                           REGULATION OF FOOD FISH
    5  SECTION 97. PRIVATE TROUT AND BLACK BASS HATCHERIES.
    6    S  97. PRIVATE TROUT AND BLACK BASS HATCHERIES.  1. THE DEPARTMENT, AT
    7  ITS DISCRETION, MAY ISSUE TO ANY PERSON A HATCHERY PERMIT, VALID  DURING
    8  THE CALENDAR YEAR OF ISSUE, TO PROPAGATE, RAISE AND SELL TROUT AND BLACK
    9  BASS  FOR  FOOD  FISH.  SUCH  PERMIT SHALL COST NO MORE THAN ONE HUNDRED
   10  DOLLARS ANNUALLY. THE DEPARTMENT SHALL ESTABLISH BY  ORDER,  REGULATIONS
   11  GOVERNING  THE IDENTIFICATION AND TRANSPORTATION OF TROUT AND BLACK BASS
   12  RAISED UNDER SUCH A PERMIT, OTHER THAN BY INDIVIDUAL TAGGING, WHICH  ARE
   13  OFFERED FOR SALE (LIVE OR OTHERWISE), SOLD OR TRANSPORTED.
   14    2. BLACK BASS ARE CONSIDERED FOOD FISH FOR HUMAN CONSUMPTION WHEN THEY
   15  MEET THE FOLLOWING CRITERIA:
   16    A. ARE BETWEEN TWELVE INCHES AND SEVENTEEN INCHES IN LENGTH;
   17    B. WEIGH BETWEEN ONE AND TWO AND ONE-HALF POUNDS;
   18    C.  ARE  FED A COMMERCIAL FISH FOOD DIET, THE COMPONENTS OF WHICH WILL
   19  BE DISCERNIBLE IN LABORATORY TESTS; AND
   20    D. ARE RAISED ON PERMITTED FARMS IN COMMERCIAL PONDS, AQUATIC CAGES OR
   21  WATER RECIRCULATION TANK FACILITIES.
   22    3. THE DEPARTMENT SHALL ISSUE  REGULATIONS  ESTABLISHING  REQUIREMENTS
   23  FOR  A BILL OF LADING WHICH MUST ACCOMPANY ANY FISH SOLD AS FOOD FISH IN
   24  NEW YORK STATE. THESE RECORDS MUST BE RETAINED BY  PERMITTED  FOOD  FISH

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD03560-01-1

       A. 448                              2

    1  HATCHERIES  AND PURCHASERS FOR A MINIMUM OF ONE YEAR. THE BILL OF LADING
    2  MUST INCLUDE AT A MINIMUM:
    3    A.  PRODUCER  INFORMATION,  INCLUDING: NAME OF THE HATCHERY OF ORIGIN;
    4  HATCHERY OWNER, ADDRESS AND CONTACT INFORMATION; HATCHERY PERMIT NUMBER;
    5  DATE OF SALE; AND A PRODUCT DESCRIPTION, INCLUDING SPECIES, QUANTITY  OR
    6  WEIGHT AND SIZE RANGE OF FISH IN INCHES.
    7    B. PURCHASER INFORMATION, INCLUDING: BUSINESS NAME OF PURCHASER; NAME,
    8  ADDRESS  AND  CONTACT  INFORMATION  OF PURCHASER; ADDRESS WHERE THE FISH
    9  WILL BE SOLD IF DIFFERENT THAN ABOVE.
   10    S 2. Section 11-1909 of the environmental conservation  law,  subdivi-
   11  sion 2 as amended by chapter 309 of the laws of 1994, is amended to read
   12  as follows:
   13  S 11-1909. Private trout and black bass hatcheries.
   14    1. The department in its discretion may issue to any person a hatchery
   15  permit, valid during the calendar year of issue, to propagate, raise and
   16  sell  trout FOR PURPOSES OTHER THAN THOSE ESTABLISHED IN SECTION NINETY-
   17  SEVEN OF THE AGRICULTURE AND MARKETS LAW.  The department  shall  estab-
   18  lish  by  order regulations governing the identification of trout raised
   19  under such a permit which are offered for sale, sold or transported.
   20    2. The department in its discretion may issue to any person a hatchery
   21  permit, valid during the calendar year of issue, to propagate, raise and
   22  sell black bass FOR PURPOSES OTHER THAN  THOSE  ESTABLISHED  IN  SECTION
   23  NINETY-SEVEN  OF  THE AGRICULTURE AND MARKETS LAW.  The department shall
   24  establish by order, regulations governing the  transportation  of  black
   25  bass raised under such a permit.
   26    S  3.  This  act shall take effect on the ninetieth day after it shall
   27  have become a law, provided, however, that  effective  immediately,  the
   28  addition,  amendment  and/or  repeal of any rule or regulation necessary
   29  for the implementation of this act on its effective date  is  authorized
   30  to be made and completed on or before such date.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the agriculture and markets law and the environmental conservation law, in relation to the regulation of food fish
